initial_reviews.review_title: It is a great resource to for marketing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Adobe Campaign?
It is great source for marketing. It is also great when combines with other adobe softwares. The built-in-reporting and targeting features has helped us to spread knowledge of our private school that would otherwise go unnoticed. we are also a nonprofit and being able to reach a wide variety of people without having to email each and every person has helped not only our administrator, but our ability to remain open and help our students with financial aid and donations.

What do you dislike about Adobe Campaign?
It can be difficult  for someone who doesn't have computer experience to use it. Being a small school, we are not able to afford a full time IT employee, this means we are very limited on who is able to help with this software since it is not New user friendly.

What problems is Adobe Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed to reach to more people in order to spread awareness of our school existence to others. We depend on outside donation and involvement to remain open and running.

It can sometimes be a bit buggy but I felt it was all to do with the tech end of things that can be fixed. The UX could also be enhanced too because I find sometimes the buttons are positioned in odd places.

all_reviews.review_title: A system that SHOULD work well but doesn't
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Adobe Campaign?
The capability for deep segmentation and personalization. Additionally, once you understand the basics of how Adobe works, you can execute simple campaigns pretty easily.

I also like visual format of how they display metrics. The data is presented in a way that is clean and easily digestable which is nice.

What do you dislike about Adobe Campaign?
The system is insanely buggy, customer service in the face of these bugs is horrible, and it is so fragile it crashes all the time. It is not at all user friendly, which is a shame because the system could be very powerful. The workflows error all the time and the error messages are not easily understandable, so it is hard to troubleshoot things on my own.

Adobe customer support is horrible - there is very little training available online for new users, and the ticketing system is not very good for fast solutions. I wish there was a chat option or something of that nature for quicker turnarounds in getting the help that I need.

Recommendations to others considering Adobe Campaign:
If you need a super powerful system and have clean data, Adobe Campaign might be right for you. However, be aware that the system is NOT user friendly and you will dedicate a lot of time to educating users and troubleshooting problems, glitches and errors.

What problems is Adobe Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Adobe Campaign for major batch campaigns and it is helpful for that. We are trying to become more sophisticated in our usage of the system, and hopefully will be able to solve more problems in the future.

all_reviews.review_title: Extremely powerful, usability has improved significantly over the last couple of years
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Adobe Campaign?
Great features, excellent advanced email delivery and tracking capabilities, all hosted platforms I have worked on have had over 97% availability. The managed services offered by Adobe is top of the line. The deliverability functionality provides an incredible amount of control with the ability to pass spam filters and ensure emails get delivered. There is also a deliverability team who are renowned experts in this field that can provide optimal configuration if required. Neolane was one of the first campaign management tool to provide mobile app integration with personalised push notifications. For the 'techies', there is also an unlimited amount of customisation that can be done.

What I like the most is that there is an unlimited potential as to what could be achieved with this platform when it comes to Marketing Automation due to the sophisticated workflows, combined with Campaign and Delivery through multiple channels with email, mobile app, direct mail (with a printing partner), SMS (with a messaging partner), Interaction (inbound channel) and social marketing (synchronising contacts from your Facebook page).

No other competitor offers such all round capabilities, although they do require the right level of expertise to fully utilise.

What do you dislike about Adobe Campaign?
Some have complained about the steep learning curve. However, this can be offset by a comprehensive implementation strategy. Bring in the right expertise and slowly build up internal capabilities with proper training of your own CRM, IT and Marketing teams.

Previously with Neolane what was gained in advanced customisation capabilities, could have been lost in intuitiveness and usability. However, following the acquisition by Adobe, the platform has matured over the years. Businesses that now use the platform and properly and follow best practices have been able to thrive with their marketing.

The usability also used to require improvements, but through the integration with other Adobe products such as AEM, content management can now also be handled with a breeze.

Reporting might be the weakest link, however there are some good out of the box reports available. For more advanced reporting, businesses can always integrate the data (post campaign execution) with other tools.

Recommendations to others considering Adobe Campaign:
I have now implemented several of these solutions and happy to share my experiences.

The best advice I can offer is that the more time that is spent on the planning, discovery phase and design, the smoother your implementation will be and the higher return on investment. It is crucial not to cut corners or reduce the size of the team required to cut costs. The right expertise is required from Adobe, their partners and your internal teams. Data SMEs should be made available for all your source systems to help with the implementation.

Also plan for what should take place post-implementation and all your non-functional requirements. What is your marketing strategy? How will your content be personalized to become more relevant for your customers and prospects? How good is the quality of your data and where are improvements required? Most of the implementations that fail do so because they don't take their time to analyse and solve all these questions prior to implementing this tool.

In addition training of your own internal users, it is also crucial to follow the best practices recommended by Adobe and avoid doing a lot of custom coding (which can be challenging to maintain in the future) unless it is really necessary. No need to reinvent the wheel.

What problems is Adobe Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
The business problems are prospects conversion, customer retention, reducing churn, automation of marketing campaigns and increasing customer loyalty.

Benefits included but were not limited to, increased control of customer life cycle, reducing un-subscriptions by getting customers to go through a short survey, increased conversions by triggering marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour and very useful tracking capabilities of received emails through open and click-rates and much more.

all_reviews.review_title: A Robust, Flexible Tool That Can Go a Long Way in the Right Hands
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Adobe Campaign?
Adobe Campaign has great customization and control over the customization. It exposes the code behind almost all of it's processes and allows a knowledgeable developer a deep expandability not seen in other tools. In many other tools, the customization is limited to what the developers have available for options or plugins. In Adobe Campaign, you have the ability to configure nearly everything. If there is a process that is too complex for a business user to do with the tool, well you can create new forms and menus for them to interact with that can automate and streamline a previously difficult process.

I also like how the process of creating campaign workflows and deliveries is very straightforward. The real time, drag and drop style canvas is very intuitive for business users to grasp. With very little training or experience they can create very segmented email deliveries.

What do you dislike about Adobe Campaign?
Usually when a tool offers exceptional flexability and customization there is a natural downside; a high learning curve and low ease of use. A user who solely has marketing experience will have a hard time doing advanced things. In today's instant gratification, hide the backend, guide-you-by-the-hand application environment, it can be frustrating for these users to have to lean on a more technologically advanced user or even a developer or Adobe Professional Services.

You need to have the right staff around you to maximize and understand the potential of this tool. This is a tool for a knowledgeable team that knows what they want and desires the capability to expand the platform for the coming years.

Recommendations to others considering Adobe Campaign:
You need to have the right staff around you to maximize and understand the potential of this tool. This is a tool for a knowledgeable team that knows what they want and desires the capability to expand the platform for the coming years.

What problems is Adobe Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
I work as a developer for an Adobe Campaign Certified Partner. Our company and I have implemented all kinds of customizations to the tool as well as handle the day to day campaign needs. We have built custom Web Applications, created and integrated custom databases into the tool, launched branding, security platforms, you name it. There have been struggles and gaps along the way, but the Adobe Staff, the documentation and especially the flexability of the tool have made even some of the toughest customer requirements possible.

all_reviews.review_title: Streamlining and automating marketing and customer communication across multiple channels
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Adobe Campaign?
The fundamental advantage of Neolane is its cross-channel marketing optimization functionality. Unlike IBM's Unica, Neolane offers marketers the ability to design and execute coordinated online (email) campaigns as well as offline (direct mail, telephone, fax, SMS) marketing campaigns. This unified platform ensures brand consistency across all channels.

Also, Neolane is not just a mere execution tool. To the contrary, it supports all campaign management phases which gives marketers better control, easier access and smoother execution, especially when multiple marketing teams are involved:
1) Planning Marketing programs
2) Designing marketing campaigns
3) Developing deliveries
4) Executing campaigns
5) Analyzing results

What do you dislike about Adobe Campaign?
No doubt, Neolane has a very well-established reputation in Europe and undisputed market leadership in France, however - on the U.S. market, they are still establishing themselves as a mature platform and "emerging leader", as recognized by the Forrester team in their Campaign Management Automation Wave. While they've been making great progress, their platform is still many times unstable, with bugs that are impossible to reproduce. Many times I would have customer demos, coming across new bugs for the first time during the presentation, and I would not be able to reproduce them afterwards - which obviously undermined my position as "the Neolane expert". Those were definitely not fun times.

What problems is Adobe Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of my recent projects was for one of the most instantly recognizable and successful publishers of child development content in U.S. The rise of e-commerce, as well as the changing distribution models for magazines, had a dramatic impact on my client's business. Here are some of the problems they were facing with:
-	Their communication with their 2 M online customers and 5 M offline was not consistent across different channels and lacked coordination with the global strategy.
-	Their marketing campaigns were executed manually and lacked personalization, resulting in long execution times and poor overall performance.

I was hired as a Marketing Consultant to address these problems that the client was facing, 2M for email 5M for offline channels.

Having a deep understanding or their business problems and making use of powerful marketing campaign management technology, I provided them with a customer centric solution, meaning that the solution focused on the customer's interests, preferences, relationships and propensity to respond. I built automated multi-wave marketing campaign templates that are segmented and personalized according to customer profiles. I also integrated their online and offline channels in these centralized campaign templates, ensuring message consistency across all these channels. And what's most remarkable is that the templates are reusable from a campaign to another and that I provided them with rigorous training and side-coaching, enabling them to reach the best potential in their daily jobs.

Results:
-	The big picture result is that they achieved significant gains in productivity, sales, and the collaboration.
-	Their team made significant gains in productivity, reducing campaign execution time in half and doubling the online and offline campaign output with no additional headcount.
-	The personalized one-to one e-mails executed using my templates generated two to five times more revenue than other-mails had in the Q1 2012.
-	They are an extremely happy client and they agreed to serve as a reference for us in this year's Forrester's industry wave on Customer Engagement Agency space.

Email marketing and landing page building are now simpler, and we have connected Neolane with our CRM system in order to automatically push qualified leads to our sales force.

all_reviews.review_title: User Friendly, Gaining Name Recognition, Great Potential
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Adobe Campaign?
I've used both IBM Unica and Neolane (v. 6.0.2) now known as Adobe Campaign.  I only have about 6 months experience using Adobe Campaign.  It can be used by someone who understands relational databases, but does not necessarily have programming experience.  I like the interface and icons that clearly distinguish the different functions. It's integrated with social media and mobile applications, and SMS campaigns.  I used this tool for both email and direct mail campaigns, and the automation process has minor glitches.  The analytics and reporting section is very helpful and easy to follow. I referenced this section more through Adobe Campaign than I do on Unica.  Integration with other CRM tools is useful, and downloading data into Excel is straightforward. Running campaigns takes about the same amount of time as Unica. We also have a Neolane consultant who visits whenever assistance is needed.  The software looks promising and has great potential, especially with Adobe acquiring Neolane. This also means resources should be more widely available.

What do you dislike about Adobe Campaign?
Glitches, freezes, technical team involved more than I'd prefer, lack of online manual and additional resources, password isn't enforced which could lead to security problems, instructor doesn't customize training based on company's needs vs Unica instructor who does customize training, but again -- this will probably be resolved as the tool becomes more popularized.

Recommendations to others considering Adobe Campaign:
I would recommend this product to other organizations, but obviously that depends on pricing, resource availability, industry type, etc. From a Campaign Business Analyst, Data Analyst, and Reporting Analyst perspective, this product is useful and can be mastered to meet your objectives.  I only see this product getting better in time with support from Adobe.  There are some bugs and glitches that need to be worked out, but this shouldn't deter anyone from using it.  Other competitive software programs have their bugs and glitches as well.

What problems is Adobe Campaign solving and how is that benefiting you?
Greater detail and accuracy (applying exclusions, criteria, segmentation, customization) for EM, DM, and SMS campaigns.
